translation: 為什麼游泳讓我感到緊張
definition: This phrase expresses the speaker's feelings of anxiety or unease about the activity of swimming.

contexts.usage: I really enjoy being in the water, but for some reason, swimming just makes me nervous. I'm not sure why.
When we discussed my fear of swimming in our last session, you asked me to explore why it makes me nervous. I think it has to do with a bad experience I had as a child.
Does anyone else struggle with feeling nervous about swimming? I'd love to hear if you've found ways to overcome that anxiety.

antonyms: be at ease in the water
note: The reasons why someone may feel nervous about swimming can vary, such as past negative experiences, a lack of confidence in the water, or an underlying fear. Exploring the source of the nervousness can help address the issue.
